III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Two staff members punched an 18-year-old youth multiple times
in the stomach while transporting the youth to the hospital and
then another time while transporting to the dentist. There were no
resulting injuries.
Investigation Interviews:
Foster Care Supervisor was interviewed via phone on July 29,
2024. Foster Care Supervisor reported Youth A disclosed these
concerns to her on July 26, 2024. She reported she did bring these
concerns up to staff at the facility. Foster Care Supervisor reported
when Youth A disclosed to her, he did not have the names of the
staff involved. She reported Youth A did not report any other youth
being present during these reported assaults. Foster Care Supervisor
reported Youth A believes if he reports these alleged assaults he will
be moved from the facility. She reported Youth A is potentially facing
charges due to assaulting another youth at the facility.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 30,
2024. Youth A reported he has been living at the facility since July
17, 2024, and hates living there. When asked why he hated living
there, Youth A began to explain that the staff assaulted him and
asked for this consultant to help get him moved from the facility.
When asked to explain what he meant by staff assaulting him, Youth
A explained that he had been punched by staff on two occasions in
the stomach. He reported the first incident he could not remember
the exact date but stated it was when he was being transported to
the hospital by Staff 2 and Staff 3. Youth A reported Staff 2 was
driving the car and had stopped at the gas station. He reported he
asked Staff 2 to get him a drink from the gas station and she told him
that he did not deserve a drink and punched him in the stomach.
Youth A reported that Staff 3 was sitting in the passenger seat and
was able to stop Staff 2 from doing that. He denied having any
bruises from this incident. Youth A reported the second incident was
2

when he was being transported to the medical area to see the dentist
on July 25, 2024. He reported he was being transported by Staff 1 to
the medical area. Youth A reported when he walked by the nurse’s
station, he saw Nurse and tried to talk to her. He reported Staff 1 told
him to stop being inappropriate and Staff 1 punched him in the
stomach. Youth A reported Nurse saw the situation occur and just
laughed at the situation. He denied having any bruises from this
situation and noted that he does not believe there are cameras near
the nurse’s station. Youth A reported he does have safe people at
the facility he can talk to. He confirmed these were the only two
incidents of being hit by staff and the specific staff that were involved.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 30,
2024. Staff 1 reported he has never transported Youth A down to
meet with medical staff or to the dentist. He reported that on July 25,
2024, he was not working on the unit that day and was in training.
Staff 1 showed this consultant verification via his timesheet showing
he was in training. He reported that he has never punched Youth A
or any youth at the facility. Staff 1 reported he is trained in using
verbal de-escalation with the youth and giving them space. He
reported Staff 2 and Staff 3 are female staff and would never be
allowed to transport Youth A to an off-grounds appointment. Staff 1
reported he has never heard or witnessed concerns of Staff 2
punching Youth A or any youth at the facility. He reported Youth A
recently assaulted another youth at the facility and he is potentially
facing new charges which is why he has been asking to get out of the
facility. Staff 1 reported when Youth A does not get his way on things
he gets upset with the staff giving a consequence and he makes up
stories to try to get the staff fired. He reported he has held Youth A
accountable for following the rules at the facility such as speaking
appropriately and having limited screen time which Youth A does not
like to follow.
Nurse was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 30,
2024. Nurse reported she was not working on July 25, 2024, when
Youth A was down meeting with the medical team. She reported she
had never seen Staff 1 bring Youth A down to the medical area.
Nurse reported she has never seen or heard from Youth A or any
youth at the facility being punched by a staff.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 30,
2024. Staff 2 reported she has never transported Youth A off-
grounds to any medical appointments or hospital visits. She reported
she and Staff 3 would never be allowed to transport Youth A or any
other youth alone because they would need at least one male staff
for safety due to this being an all-male youth facility. Staff 2 denied
ever bringing Youth A to the gas station or punching him in the
stomach. She reported she has never punched any youth at the
3

facility. Staff 2 reported she is trained in using verbal de-escalation
with the youth. She reported she has never heard or seen Staff 1
punch any youth at the facility. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 is the staff the
youth always ask to come to work with them on shift because they
like working with him. She reported Youth A does not like being held
accountable for his actions and will be quick to try to tell staff that he
will get them fired. Staff 2 reported Youth A is also acting out of fear
mode because he is potentially facing new criminal charges for
assaulting a peer at the facility.
Staff 3 was interviewed via phone on July 31, 2024. Staff 3
reported she transported Youth A to a hospital visit on July 21, 2024,
due to him sticking crayons in his ears. She reported Staff 4 went
with her to the hospital, as there cannot be two female staff to
transport a male youth. Staff 3 reported there was never a stop at a
gas station, and she never witnessed Youth A getting punched by
anyone. She denied Staff 2 being involved with this hospital trip. Staff
3 reported she has worked with both Staff 1 and Staff 2 and denied
ever seeing or hearing of either of them punching a youth at the
facility. She reported staff are trained to use verbal de-escalation with
the youth. Staff 3 reported Youth A has never made complaints to
her about a staff punching him and she has never seen this occur.
Staff 4 was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 30,
2024. Staff 4 reported he drove Youth A to the hospital on July 21,
2024, with Staff 3. He reported there was no concerns during the trip
and denied Youth A ever getting punched by a staff member during
this outing.
Administrator was interviewed face to face at the facility on July
30, 2024. Administrator reported he was made aware Youth A made
the complaint that unknown staff punched him in the stomach. He
reported Youth A has only been at the facility for a couple of weeks
and has never made these complaints to other staff or medical staff.
Administrator verified Staff 1 was at training all day on July 25, 2024,
and not working with Youth A. He confirmed Staff 2 and Staff 3 never
transported Youth A to an off-grounds medical appointment.
Administrator reported Youth A is currently facing new charges due
to assaulting a peer which has increased his anxiety about his next
placement.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of July 25, 2024, in the nurses’ station/medical area
was reviewed on July 30, 2024. Video recording starts at 6:58pm,
Staff 7 walked first into the nurses’ station then Youth A and Staff 8
was the last to enter. Youth A walked in through the door while Staff
7 held the door open. Youth A walked into the medical office with
Staff 7 followed behind him and Staff 8 followed Staff 7. Youth A
4

went into the medical office, Staff 7 stood in the medical office for a
few moments then sat in the office, and Staff 8 sat outside the
medical office. Staff 7 exited the office and stood with Staff 8 outside
the office. Youth A exited the office, Staff 7 walked in front of Youth
A, and Staff 8 was behind Youth A as they headed to the door to exit
the nurses’ station. Staff 7 opened the door to exit with Youth A
followed behind her and Staff 8 followed behind Youth A. Video
footage ended at 7:03pm. Within the video, Staff 1 and Nurse were
never seen. The video footage reviewed did not show Youth A
getting assaulted by any staff.
Documents Reviewed:
- Staff 1’s Personnel File- There was no disciplinary record
and Staff 1 completed the required trainings. He completed
Crisis Intervention- Verbal De-escalation Training on February
22, 2024, Handle with Care Physical Practicum on March 21,
2024, and Child Management Technique/Discipline
Techniques on May 23, 2024.
- Staff 2’s Personnel File- There was no disciplinary record
and Staff 2 completed the required trainings. She completed
Handle with Care Physical Practicum on March 21, 2024, and
Child Management Technique/Discipline Techniques on May
23, 2024.
- Staff 3’s Personnel File- There was no disciplinary record
and Staff 3 completed the required trainings. She completed
Handle with Care Physical Practicum on March 21, 2024, and
Child Management Technique/Discipline Techniques on May
23, 2024.
- Staff 4’s Personnel File- There was no disciplinary record
and Staff 4 completed the required trainings. He completed
Crisis Intervention- Verbal De-escalation Training on February
22, 2024, Handle with Care Physical Practicum on March 21,
2024, and Child Management Technique/Discipline
- Facility’s Youth Discipline and Behavior Modification
Policy- This policy notes the facility prohibits cruel and
unusual punishment including any type of physical discipline.
- Facility incident report dated July 21, 2024- Youth A stuck
crayons in both of his ears and staff responded. Youth A was
transported to the medical hospital with Staff 3 and Staff 4.
- Facility incident report dated July 25, 2024- Youth A stuck
crayons in both of his ears and staff responded. Youth A was
transported to the medical hospital with Staff 5 and Staff 6.
- Youth A’s Daily Movement Report- Youth A had only been
transported twice to the hospital which were on July 21, 2024,
and July 25, 2024. Staff 3 and Staff 4 transported Youth A on
July 21, 2024. Staff 5 and Staff 6 transported Youth A on July
25, 2024.
5

Analysis The facility is found in compliance as Youth A identified Staff 1
and Staff 2 as the staff that abused him and there is no
information to support the allegations. Staff 1 did not take Youth A
to the nurses’ station on July 25, 2024. Video was reviewed during
the time Youth A was near the nurses’ station, there was no
assault that occurred. Staff 2 never transported Youth A to the
hospital either time Youth A went to the hospital per interviews
and documentation reviewed.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
